question: Which country houses the "Tusheti National Park"?
explanation: The Tusheti National Park is an IUCN category II national park located in eastern Georgia which is one of the eight new protected areas approved by Parliament of Georgia on 22 April 2003. The Global Environment Facility (GEF) and the World Bank were part of this approval process under the "Georgia – Protected Areas Development Project". Plants conserved in the park are pine groves and birch groves. The Tusheti Protected Areas includes Tusheti National Park, Tusheti Protected Landscape and Tusheti Strict Nature Reserve. The key faunal species in the park are the Anatolian leopard, bear, chamois, falcon, golden eagle, lammergeyer, lynx, wild goat and wolf. The park was named one of the "12 best places you’ve never heard of" by BudgetTravel in 2011 not only for its rich biodiversity but also for its aesthetic terrain, hamlets, old defence towers, cuisine, and folk culture.
